DOC.brief_summary: This study design determine whether pelvic examination ( include bimanual speculum examination ) necessary patient first trim vaginal bleeding/ lower abdominal pain intra-uterine pregnancy ( IUP ) see ultrasound . Patients chief complaint vaginal bleed low abdominal pain le 16 week positive HCG consider non-inferiority-designed clinical trial . All patient present BMC Emergency Department ( ED ) Mon - Fri 8am 11pm serum urine HCG test formal ultrasound credentialed emergency physician radiology technician part standard care screen eligibility . Those patient intra-uterine pregnancy < 16 week gestation see ultrasound meet inclusion criterion ask provide informed consent participate study . Randomization occur consent obtain . Half patient randomize receive pelvic examination half . Further care determine treat attend physician . The primary outcome composite morbidity endpoint 30 day , include return visit ED , emergency surgery , need transfusion , infection , miss source bleeding/ pain . Secondary outcomes interest include ED throughput time , patient satisfaction .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Chief complaint vaginal bleed low abdominal pain 2 . Intrauterine pregnancy see ultrasound 3 . Date < 16 week estimate LMP ultrasound 4 . Age > 21 5 . Ability provide write informed consent 6 . English speak 1 . Already enrol study 2 . Morbid Obesity ( BMI > 40 ) 3 . Pelvic exam perform prior ultrasound result 4 . Prisoner 5 . Follow assure 6 . Admitted hospital 7 . Large amount vaginal bleeding ( > 10 pad 24 hour equivalent ) 8 . Unstable vital sign ( SBP < 90 HR > 110 ) 9 . Known cervical carcinoma past 1 year 10 . Clinical suspicion alternative syndrome require pelvic exam ( severe pain consistent ovarian torsion ) 11 . Report suspicion penetrate vaginal trauma 12 . Suspicion Active Labor 13 . Reported Sexual Assault 14 . Current pregnancy IVF 15 . IUD place 16 . Suspicion heterotopic pregnancy ultrasound
